title: Inspiring initiatives to preserve homestead
text:
Inspiring initiatives to preserve homestead 0 comments 
Right next door to Strawberry Hill's trademark historic 1798 "Pink" Log Cabin is another log cabin of the same era. The cabin is the home of the Hobbit House Pottery workshop. Prior to becoming the workshop, a store serving Mount Hope once stood below, known as the "Lightner General Store." 
The general store opened in 1895. In 1903, Harry and Effie Lightner took over operations until the advent of the supermarket and affordable access to the automobile forced the store to close in the early 1960s. kAmq@E9 423:?D H6C6 E96 {:89E?6CDV 9@>6DE625 H96C6 w2CCJ 2?5 t77:6 96=A65 C2:D6 D6G6? 8C2?549:=5C6?j @?6 @7 E96D6 8C2?549:=5C6? 36:?8 %9@>2D t] |6EK[ H9@ 8C6H FA @?
